content.question: Which of the following is a properly matched comparison of Iran and Russia?

choices.label: Iran is an illiberal democracy, while Russia is a democratic regime.
Iran has universal suffrage, while the president of Russia is appointed by the legislature.
Iran is a theocracy, while Russia has been classified as an authoritarian regime.
A military government rules in Iran, while Russia is a one-party state that allows no other parties to compete.

content.answer: Iran is a theocracy, while Russia has been classified as an authoritarian regime.

skill.text: Skill 2.A: Compare two or more course countries based on their political systems, principles, institutions, processes, policies, and behaviors.
